intro: Petrea kohautiana, commonly known as the Hawaiian flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with elongated, lance-shaped leaflets. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing along coastal areas. Petrea kohautiana is valued for its ornamental beauty and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its native habitat.
